So it would fall under the same category. Is this intended?

timeline.message:
Remove IBattleCalculator#getThreadCount

This method is only used for display purposes, a detail that might not even be accurate.

timeline.bodyText:
Should this remain as an abstract method?
At first glance it seems like Fast AI would want to return its own player type.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: Right, wanted to make this change, but forgot to do so
replies.author: RoiEXLab

timeline.bodyText: Side-note, ProLogXX should probably be specific to the ProAI; it seems we have a more generic tool and it should instead be the AiLogUi and/or AiLogger
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: I believe the log UI initialize is used for both the pro and fast ai.
replies.author: ron-murhammer

timeline.bodyText: This method could perhaps use a javadoc to explain what we would expect implementations to do, and to define prepareData
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText:
nit, we probably should be shooting for the dependency to be on an interface where it so happens that AbstractProAi implements that interface. To get there we may have to think a bit more about the modelling of this one AI and which interfaces it makes sense to have.
To another extent, we should perhaps also consider 'interface segregation principal' and how many interfaces we would need so that a dependency like this is only given an interface where it actually uses everything that is passed to it.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText: Question/side-comment: if we are making a copy of GameData for the battle calculator, do you know why we need to lock it?
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText:
I added a javadoc to the mutex field that should clarify this question.
Basically the mutex is not for thread safety, but rather for thread consistency.
Without this mutex it could happen that the gamedata is changed when we're actively deserializing the gamedata to create BattleCalculator workers, so the first x workers have the old data and the last y workers use the newer data which would screw up the results
replies.author: RoiEXLab

timeline.message: Move method up one layer to enforce overriding
